member.name: F:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.Debug.CpuTimers
member.summary: e.g.: using (Telemetry.Debug.CpuTimers.YourTimerNameHere) { /* stuff to time */ }

member.name: F:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.Debug.Counters
member.summary: e.g.: Telemetry.Debug.Counters.YourCounterNameHere.Increment();

member.name: M:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.Debug.AddCustomRegistrationAction(System.Action{System.String,Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.IProbe})
member.summary: Use this to register a custom action that will be called each time someone creates a dynamic CpuTimer (with Telemetry.Debug.CpuTimers.YourTimerNameHere). The parameters are the user-provided name (e.g. "YourTimerNameHere" in the above example and the created CpuTimer. E.g. the kernel registers an action that for each timer automatically creates a derived probe showing the values per cycle.

member.name: P:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.IProbe.ValueDouble
member.summary: Current value of probe.

member.name: P:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.IProbe`1.Value
member.summary: Current typed value of probe.

member.name: M:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.ResetTelemetrySystem
member.summary: Global reset of all telemetry probes to zero (or the equivalent). This is mainly used for benchmarking, e.g. to cleanly restart telemetry after a warm up phase or before a new benchmark iteration. Custom IProbe implementations must handle the Telemetry.OnReset event.

member.name: E:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.OnReset
member.summary: Signals that ResetTelemetrySystem has been called. Custom IProbe implementations must handle the Telemetry.OnReset event.

member.name: T:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.StopWatchTime
member.summary: Uses a StopWatch to time the code block. Measurement also includes times when the thread is blocked.

member.name: T:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.WallClockTime
member.summary: Overlapping timings from multiple threads will not be accumulated. For example, if 4 threads simultanously time a code block at 1 second using the same WallClockTime object, then recorded time will show 1 second. This is in contrast to CpuTime where it would show 4 seconds.

member.name: T:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.CpuTime
member.summary: Measures the amount of time that the thread has spent using the processor (application code + operating system code).

member.name: P:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.CpuTime.UserTime
member.summary: Gets the time that was spent in application code.

member.name: P:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.CpuTime.PrivilegedTime
member.summary: Gets the time that was spent in operating system code.

member.name: T:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.CpuTimeUser
member.summary: Measures the amount of time that the thread has spent using the processor inside the application.

member.name: T:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.CpuTimePrivileged
member.summary: Measures the amount of time that the thread has spent using the processor inside the operating system core.

member.name: T:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.SnapshotProbeLong
member.summary: Reports difference to current value of probe.

member.name: M:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.SnapshotProbeLong.#ctor(Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.IProbe{System.Int64})
member.summary: Reports difference to current value of probe.

member.name: T:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.SnapshotProbeDouble
member.summary: Reports difference to current value of probe.

member.name: M:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.SnapshotProbeDouble.#ctor(Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.IProbe{System.Double})
member.summary: Reports difference to current value of probe.

member.name: T:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.SnapshotProbeTimeSpan
member.summary: Reports difference to current value of probe.

member.name: M:Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.SnapshotProbeTimeSpan.#ctor(Aardvark.Base.Telemetry.IProbe{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Reports difference to current value of probe.
